messages.message: *This polly is closed.* *Anant Bhardwaj* (Polly Sender: @Anant) has a polly for you!
Is this the right website?  https://www.cursor.com/
Did you vote without even knowing?
I looked for a "What's cursor?" option but alas... :joy:
I voted for that and then realized it was .com instead of .ai
cursor.ai (http://cursor.ai) looks odd in the web
cursor is great! Very easy to get used to since its just vscode and it gives much better codebase wide prompts and search! It also adds features very fast and gets the best models.
Also, I find copilot somewhat useful, but it still leaves me a lot of work and validation to do before it is productive.

Honestly until I can use stuff in neovim I just don't bother :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:
Ok I'm done with my "yes but that applies to literally _one person ever_ - and it's you, Cody" commentary :smile:

I vote for Option 3: Allowance for whatever your favorite AI helper is.

I use Claude constantly (and pay out of pocket), but would also happily use Intellij’s paid AI Assistant plugin if it were made available. I wouldn’t want to shift from IntelliJ to Cursor.

Claude is 50% the cost of Cursor, and AI Assistant is 25% the cost.
@Cody Boggs I use copilot in vim

Yea I recall seeing some plugins that purport to support copilot, I just haven't had a need yet. :slightly_smiling_face:
Also I don't actually know if cursor works in vim or not, to be honest. :smile: If it's just another LSP-compatible thing, it _should_ work with ALE and the like. :man-shrugging::skin-tone-3:
cursor allows vim too, should look into it
@Chris Cowell I agree, just letting people get a stipend for an ai code editor and letting ppl try out their preferred newest tech would be awesome

Honestly my brain is about as good at retaining memories as a fishing net is at holding onto seawater, so I've avoided AI tools lest I just entirely forget how any of the nuts and bolts work. :upside_down_face: (Then again I also don't write any code here aside from config glue because the dumpster fire is real, y'all ... so there's that)

Cursor isn't useful in my role, but I use Claude several times a day for copyediting, iterating on UI text, understanding highly complex topics, rubber-ducking technical issues, etc.

I pay out-of-pocket for Claude despite using it mostly for work, so I second @Chris Cowell’s suggestion of an AI "allowance" to let us choose the tool that works best for us.
I do the same for Claude right now.  I am currently comparing the cursor (14 day trial) to results I get from Claude who is helping me build a couple apps.

One obvious caution about Cursor is that it’s not just an AI helper, but a whole new IDE/editor.

Cursor is fairly familiar to VS Code users, but some of us are dedicated to other IDEs and would prefer to use AI tools that let us stay within our familiar ecosystem.

@melissa.amos, @Chris Cowell -- for the docs/training team, we can think of Claude instead of Cursor.

The reason Cursor for the eng team is that it is a full editor that can take our entire codebase as context, help refactor, write new code, generate test code, and many more other things.
On the same note, was anyone able to load crafting sandbox on Cursor?
